attributes.action: Allow the President of the United States to visit the UK to create trade options
attributes.background: Banning Donald Trump from entering the UK would diminish the chances of creating a competitive trade deal with the EU. Put differences aside and try and boost the UK's negotiation position at this crucial time. Donald Trump will leave office one day.
attributes.additional_details: The EU will soon enter into negotiations with the U.K.  To make sure that a competitive deal is reached that can benefit both sides, there needs to be viable alternatives. The United States is the largest economy in the world. To limit trade ties would be a waste just because the President has ideological differences. One day Donald Trump will leave office and it would have been a waste to sideline the President, Donald Trump has already expressed interest in UK trade.

attributes.action: Implement a 20% tariff on all goods imported from the United States of America
attributes.background:
After a row over who would pay for a wall between the USA & Mexico, a bilateral summit between the two nations was cancelled by the Mexican president.
In response, President Trump now seeks to impose a 20% tariff on all Mexican goods.
In response the UK should impose a similar penalty on the USA.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition is to ask the house to debate the imposition of a similarly punitive trade tariff as that which President Trump wishes to impose on Mexico. The whole world needs to stand up to bullies and the UK should lead by example.

The last time the world appeased a bully, 80 years ago, it didn't end well.

attributes.action: Amend the planning guidance to increase the minimum size for car parking spaces.
attributes.background: Car parking space width is simply not wide enough to allow people to get out and in their vehicle comfortably enough.

attributes.action: Before any vote on Article 50 the government must publish the trade consequences
attributes.background: MP's would be stupid to trigger Article 50 without first knowing the trade rules that would come into effect as a result. The referendum ballot did not permit MP's to be irresponsible. The public have a right to know what trade rules MPs will put in place if they decide to vote to trigger Article 50
attributes.additional_details: Only 37% of the electorate voted "leave". The vast majority of the electorate want conditions to improve following any parliamentary vote on Article 50. MPs must be able to assure the public that if they vote to trigger Article 50, trading relations will not be worsened and restrictions will not be placed on financial institutions that will damage our economy. Therefore before any parliamentary vote on Article 50, MPs must publish in full all the arrangements that will then come into effect.

attributes.action: Reduce school summer holidays from 6 weeks to 2.
attributes.background: As a working parent I find it almost impossible to find affordable childcare for my children during the 6 weeks holidays. Most people only receive 21 days annual leave from work.
attributes.additional_details: With lack of affordable childcare for primary and high school aged children, it makes it almost impossible for most parents to find or afford childcare for the six week summer holiday. We need to move with the times and support people who want to work. Children are no longer required to help with summer harvest. 6 weeks is too long!

attributes.action: Urge Broadband Companies to change old aluminium wires to copper for fibre optic
attributes.background: I have an old aluminium line that goes a fair distance which causes a lot of drop off in the connection, as aluminium is a worse conductor in comparison to copper. Households across England get offered broadband packages that connection lines cannot deliver due to old forgotten aluminium cables.
attributes.additional_details: I live in Milton Keynes, in an area called two mile ash where aluminium is used, I am fairly far away from the cabinet I’m connected to which causes me to get a max connection of 10.5Mbps download and 1Mbps upload. Houses further than me experience a worse drop off rate however an area near me called Emerson valley, where they've used copper can reach speeds of 54Mbps download and 13Mbps upload copper makes a big difference and should be the standard for a modern faster England.

attributes.action: Hold a general election as so we can vote on the policies of Brexit.
attributes.background: We are facing Brexit whether you voted for it or not. Now we need to vote on the terms of the Brexit. An unelected leader should not lead the Brexit negations.
attributes.additional_details:
A general election should be held to allow our parties to form their plan for Brexit allowing the electorate to have a say with the power of a vote. 

An unelected leader is not the right person for the job.

attributes.action: Improve the quality and amount of PE in schools and spend more on school dinners
attributes.background: We are a group of Year 10 students at Greenwood Academy in Birmingham. We are campaigning to increase the amount of PE lessons in school and improve the quality of them in order to help get students healthier. We also feel school dinners lack the nutrition necessary to have healthier young people.

attributes.action: Ban smoking in all public places in the UK
attributes.background:
Why are we still breathing in smoke that we know will kill us, even when we've chosen not to?
Those of us who have decided not to smoke, or to give up, are still forced to inhale cigarette smoke every time we go for a walk or take our children to the park or pop to the shops! It's not right!
attributes.additional_details:
Smoking is the primary cause of preventable illness and premature death, accounting for approximately 96,000 deaths a year in the United Kingdom.

Smoking harms nearly every organ of the body and dramatically reduces both quality of life and life expectancy.

The 2010 US Surgeon General report, ‘How Tobacco Smoke Causes Disease’, concludes that “there is no risk-free level of exposure to tobacco smoke, and there is no safe tobacco product".

attributes.action: A standard internet speed of 24 megabits per second (Mbps) for the UK.
attributes.background: In the 21st Century our lives are dependent on the internet; while in Dorset, Eng we have to depend on 0.64 Mbps download. This is humiliatingly far behind other nations' and insufficient to even stream a film. Therefore, we propose a minimum speed of 24 Mbps that will ensure fair speeds for the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some examples of the poor speeds from across the UK:

http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/article/38067272/autumn-statement-five-places-you-say-need-better-broadband-around-the-uk

In rural Dorset: http://www.speedtest.net/my-result/5904028990

http://www.techdigest.tv/2016/12/4g-coverage-better-in-peru-than-britain-says-damning-report-from-lord-adonis.html

http://www.telecomstechnews.com/news/2016/dec/20/uk-14-million-premises-lack-decent-broadband-connections-finds-ofcom/

attributes.action: Make it illegal for parents to stop the other parent seeing their children
attributes.background: Some parents use children as a weapon to hurt the other parent. This is wrong in many ways and needs to stop. Let's get something done about it! Make it illegal for parents to do this without a court order or police recommendation

attributes.action: Stop Corporation tax cuts and put the Money into Social Care.
attributes.background: £4.6 BILLION in corporation tax cuts is currently being planned by the Tory Party.   Yesterday, Wednesday 14th Dec, in the last Prime ministers question time of the year,  Jeremy Corbyn MP appealed for the £4.6b in corporation tax cuts be put into Social care instead to help solve this crisis.
attributes.additional_details:
The Tory government has cut Social Care and the PM, cabinet, and everybody else knows the effects of these cuts.This crisis is a difficult one for many elderly people because it is also a crisis for the NHS. Those people who are in hospital cannot be discharged because there is nowhere else for them to go. The crisis affects individuals, families and The NHS. 

References
https://youtu.be/p_gl4Z-PJTk

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/m.huffpost.com/uk/entry/uk_585149c8e4b08b39538f4bf0/amp

https://www.politicshome.com/news/uk/politics/news/81735/live-prime-ministers-questions-141216

attributes.action: Have a referendum to approve a surcharge to all taxes for health & social care.
attributes.background: The main political parties are nervous of raising taxes for any purpose because of a possible election backlash. By holding a referendum, and assuming the answer is "yes", the party in government will have a mandate to raise taxation for this particular purpose.
attributes.additional_details: We are currently in a health and social care funding crisis. Local government has the responsibility but not the funds and in some case, the inclination, to support social care adequately. NHS trusts may be administratively inefficient and that has to be corrected but funding for the "sharp end" is inadequate and has to be corrected, and not by short term injections of funds.

attributes.action: "Remain" should not be an option if a second referendum is agreed.
attributes.background:
Including "remain" in any second referendum on the deal achieved by the UK government would only serve to undermine the governments position and be intended to prevent the UK leaving the European Union.

MPs that wish to ignore the vote of the British people should reveal themselves.
attributes.additional_details:
All too often "I respect the outcome of the referendum to leave the European Union...but" is uttered by fervent supporters of the EU.  

It is all too often accompanied by proposals of a second referendum "on the terms" of our exit from the EU; this is designed to undermine UK government negotiations and ultimately thwart the outcome of the referendum of the 23rd June 2016.

A second referendum should only be on the terms agreed to EXIT the EU.

attributes.action: Save Our Children's Centre's and say no to closures
attributes.background: Lot's of jobs are being cut to save money. If this is done then Children's Centres will be effected.
attributes.additional_details: Please sign this petition to help try and save our centres....This is not only for the parents but also for every child and member of the community who uses these places on a day to day basis.

attributes.action: Move council tax non-payment months to Dec & Jan to help with winter fuel costs
attributes.background: On a 10 month direct debit plan, council tax isn't paid in April or May, please just change that to December and January to give everyone more money during the cold winter months to help with fuel costs and Christmas expenses.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government can make all councils do this by amending the Council Tax (Administration and Enforcement) Regulations 1992.

attributes.action: Install speed cameras along the A52 from Priory island to Bramcote island.
attributes.background: To many people are tragically losing their lives along this stretch of road as people see it as a race track, I propose that speed cameras are installed to deter and hopefully lower the number of deaths that occur on this road.
attributes.additional_details: After a tragic accident on the 25th November 2016 that killed 2 people because of dangerous driving, this could have been prevented with speed cameras.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for all new parents to learn CPR before leaving maternity unit
attributes.background: Any new parent should be taught CPR and basic life support skills before leaving the maternity into with their newborn child. This should include choking, unconsciousness, CPR to help increase chance of survival if the unimaginable happens.

attributes.action: Make tractor drivers pass a HGV test due to to the weights tractors can now haul
attributes.background: Tractor tests have been very simple since the war, the machines themselves have got larger in comparison, the power and weight hauling capability has also increased, but the drivers exprience or knowledge has not. A tractor slid across a field with a near miss of children who were on adjacent land.

attributes.action: Make Makaton sign language part of the national curriculum and the EYFS
attributes.background: Makaton is a form of sign language used by many people with hearing or speech disabilities, if Makaton was taught from a young age signing would become as natural as learning your first language. If everyone could sign it would break down barriers, for people with disabilities and unite people.

attributes.action: Require the Cabinet ministers to have experience relevant to their roles.
attributes.background: In most public sector jobs the relevant Cabinet minister has little/no experience actually doing any of the jobs they oversee. It would give them more credibility if they have done the jobs in the sector that they're responsible for. eg.The minister for health should have worked in healthcare.

attributes.action: Petition to make Dementia Awareness a mandatory subject in citizenship
attributes.background: I currently work in a dementia and complex needs hospital for the mental health service in the east of England. As we are aware, mental health has a stigma; and many don't realise dementia does too! Basic dementia awareness is not known to the general public. This needs to change and quickly.
attributes.additional_details:
Dementia is an umbrella term for a range of cognitive impairments, that progressively get worse over time.
According to Alzheimer's Society - "There are 850,000 people with dementia in the UK, with numbers set to rise to over 1 million by 2025. 225,000 will develop dementia this yea; that’s one every three minutes!" And most shockingly "There are over 40,000 people under 65 with dementia in the UK".

Yet, many people do not have basic understanding of the signs and symptoms for Dementia.

attributes.action: Give self-build eco-homes by local families automatic planning permission.
attributes.background: We live in a village and have outgrown our home. We bought a corner of a field close to the village centre to build an affordable Eco-home. This year 278 homes have been approved for building on fields within 2 miles of our site by commercial builders. Ours was refused. It's a double standard.
attributes.additional_details: Local Planning Authorities are supposed to be supporting self-builds, eco-homes, affordable homes and local people. Our LPA refused our application even though no measurable harm was established. High-impact commercial developments with big numbers of homes are favoured. This is wrong and is holding back the solution to the housing supply shortfall.

attributes.action: Ensure that fireworks remain unrestricted to the general public.
attributes.background: A petition to ensure that the general public can (and in future will be able to) purchase fireworks for home displays without undue restrictions.

attributes.action: Reinstate George Osborne's plan to set up a 2nd hand annuity market
attributes.background: People have been waiting nearly two years to be able to sell their poor monthly payments for cash lump sums where they can make a difference to their lives.   For example, I've sat with no working boiler as I can't afford one without my annuity funds in one payment.

attributes.action: Full pension rights for people thrown out  of the navy for living with ts person
attributes.background: Living with ts person was illegal back in 82, I was kicked out for this crime but I was 21 at the time and doing nothing wrong under cival law, now a days you get to stay in if you fall in love with a ts.I find it repugnent not to eben have had a simple sorry from the powers that be.

attributes.action: No confidence vote in Amber Rudd for denying visa to bone marrow donor.
attributes.background: May Brown, 23, from Dorset, who has leukaemia, has been told that her Nigerian sister Martha is a "10 out of 10" tissue match.  However, the Home Office denied a visa because "all visa applications must be assessed against the immigration rules".
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-dorset-37656377

attributes.action: Increase the number of specialist road traffic officers to reduce road deaths
attributes.background: 10,732 people died on UK roads between 2010 and 2015. In the period Jan to March 2016 alone saw a 14% increase in reported road deaths. Without the fear of detection, non-compliance of road safety rules and laws is noticeably increasing. Enforcement is no longer supporting education or engineering
attributes.additional_details:
"The level of enforcement on our roads is woefully inadequate, 
between 2010 and 2014 the UK has seen a 27% reduction in the number of specialist road traffic police on the roads (falling from 5,338 to 3,901) outside of London". Brake-the road safety charity
Without a visible police presence, road users no longer fear being caught and are increasing non-compliant and yet detection rates are falling
Between 2010-15 133,565 people were seriously injured
Motor insurers paid out £27m per day in 2015

attributes.action: To change the laws on criminals being prosecuted on the account of rape.
attributes.background: This petition is to change the minimum jail sentence length and to rule out community service as a legitimate charge. Victims dealing with cases such as this deserve to be able to go about their lives as they wish, without having the fear of running into their offenders.
attributes.additional_details: Personally, I don't think that community service is an appropriate sentence for someone being convicted of rape. The victims and their families would have been put through hell and the perpetrator receiving community service for however long is basically letting them get away with it, when the victims deserve a lot more justice for the crime that was committed.

attributes.action: Make it law to carry a breakdown warning triangle in every motor vehicle.
attributes.background: If a warning triangle is displayed 100 metres behind a broken down vehicle, it will decrease the chances of someone else crashing into it. What if you had broken down somewhere awkward like a roundabout or a bridge without a hard shoulder?
attributes.additional_details:
It is already mandatory in France to carry a warning triangle.

It alerts other road users to a breakdown so they have enough time to react.

It is very effective on motorways where there is no hard shoulder.

It is known to reduce the amount of accidents involving broken down vehicles.

attributes.action: Ban the use of button batteries in children's toys
attributes.background:
The UK is seeing a large increase in serious injuries, and in some cases death, from children swallowing button batteries. 
At the same time, we are seeing an large increase in the use of button batteries in children's toys. 
Surely this cannot be coincidence?
attributes.additional_details:
Why are we using several button batteries when a single AA or AAA battery would do the same job with a minimal increase in size? 
AA type batteries are much less appetising to toddlers and babies who have managed to open their toys to reveal a potentially fatal prize, as well as being much harder to swallow.
My toddler hasn't been injured, thankfully, but when I started to think about how many of his toys contain 3 or 4 of these batteries each, I became quite concerned.

attributes.action: Abolish psychiatric electroconvulsive therapy – ECT - electroshock to the brain
attributes.background: ECT causes brain cell death, brain bleed and swelling. It can cause permanent memory loss, cognitive impairment and even death. It can trigger suicide. ECT machines have never been independently inspected or approved for medical safety, not even by the regulators for the UK - MHRA or the US – FDA.
attributes.additional_details: Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) is a psychiatric procedure where up to 400 volts is put through the brain for up to 8 seconds causing an epileptic fit purportedly to relieve mental distress.   Mainly given to women and the elderly, sometimes to children and often without consent.  Patients are rarely fully informed about the potential harm.  Dr Peter Breggin states ECT produces a ‘closed head injury high’ www.ectresources.org. Abolish ECT. www.speakoutagainstpsychiatry.org

attributes.action: Have older drivers be assessed free of charge once hitting a particular age.
attributes.background: Every year thousands of UK drivers are involved in a road traffic collision of some kind and unfortunately a lot are OAP's. For some older people there reaction times and awareness on the road are limited.
attributes.additional_details: A goverment funded assessment should be put into place to assess any older drivers once they hit a particular age to be passed as safe to be on UK roads. By doing this thousands of lives can be saved and while not every driver above a particular age is unsafe on the road many are also unaware of there dangerous driving style. Help save lives by supporting a goverment funded assessment to unsure everyone is safe on the road.

attributes.action: Seek a UN treaty on mutual recognition and enforcement of telephone privacy laws
attributes.background: Despite using the TPS, I have been bombarded with spam telephone calls from India and some other foreign countries. Many of these calls are barely disguised scams. Within the EU there is mutual recognition of such schemes and it works well. This should be extended by treaty to all nations in the ITU
attributes.additional_details:
TPS = Telephone Preference Service
ITU = International Telecommunications Union, a UN agency

To understand what gave me this idea, see: https://www.quora.com/What-is-the-creepiest-phone-call-or-voice-message-youve-ever-received/answer/Peter-Charlot and my (Charles Stuart) comment.

Ofcom recognizes that people outside the EU are beyond their control. I would like a treaty to address this and set up mandatory reciprocal recognition of cold calling laws among ITU member states.

attributes.action: Reduce the working day to 6 hours with the same salary.
attributes.background:
Companies in Sweden have reduced the working hours of their employees to six hours, reporting happier staff, a lower turnover rate, and an increase in profits in that time.

Who doesn't want to spend more time with their friends and family, whilst also being more motivated and productive at work?
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/sweden-introduces-six-hour-work-day-a6674646.html

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/business/the-six-hour-work-day-increases-productivity-so-will-britain-and-america-adopt-one-sweden-a7066961.html

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-34677949

attributes.action: Make ASLs (Bicycle boxes) illegal for motor vehicles to stop or rest in.
attributes.background: The Advanced Stop Line (Bicycle box) is consistently and wrongly used by motor vehicles stop in, despite it not being allowed, it's not a fineable offence unless an officer sees one enter it. They are there for cyclists safety and should be treated like yellow box junctions by motor vehicles.

attributes.action: Free prescriptions for stroke survivors
attributes.background: Make prescriptions free of charge on any medication for stroke survivors

attributes.action: Make it illegal for data companies to sell any personal data to any third party.
attributes.background: I receive in the region of 10-15 cold-calls every day. These calls cannot currently be blocked by BT and are only subject to Telephone Preference if made within the UK.
attributes.additional_details: If these calls were being made within the UK, and assuming that the person receiving them has signed up to TPS, then the company making the call could be prosecuted, as could the company who sold the data, because they had not made the required checks against the TPS data base. Unfortunately, this does not apply to overseas call centres. However, if the companies that sell this data were closed down, eventually the problem would stop.

attributes.action: Prevent closure of Path House Mental Health Crisis Service in Ludlow.
attributes.background: The fundamental benefit of Path House is to offer guests a homely but therapeutic alternative to hospital admission as this is financially very costly and often vastly unnecessary or inappropriate for the individual; preferring a less extreme route to recovery.
attributes.additional_details: Shropshire CCG say that Path House would be better suited to a location in either Shrewsbury or North Shropshire as it is "under-occupied". It's our belief that Path's location in Ludlow is what makes it such a special and unique service, the town provides peace and calm and for the majority of our guests that come from larger towns; Ludlow offers the anonymity that guests largely benefit from. The location is only undesirable from the point of view of the CCG in terms of traveling the A49 for reviews and transporting guests. From our point of view and that of the guest; the location is what aids and improves recovery so that guests can return home sooner than they ordinarily would be able to.

attributes.action: Make 'name blind' recruitment a legal requirement
attributes.background:
The Equality Act 2010 made discrimination based on race, religion, gender, disability and sexual orientation illegal. 

Yet employers routinely discriminate against those with a foriegn sounding name on their cvs despite them having identical qualifications to other candidates. This must end now.
attributes.additional_details:
A recent BBC report stated that candidates with an ‘English-sounding name’ could be offered three times the number of interviews than an applicant with a Muslim name with the same qualifications.

Similarly, those with African or Caribbean sounding names are equally discriminated against as are women:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/38751307?client=ms-android-orange-gb. 
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/34636464?client=ms-android-orange-gb.

This creates an unequal society for UK citizens.

attributes.action: Stop nurseries charging fees when children are sick or on holiday.
attributes.background: Many nurseries charge 100% fees when a child does not attend due to sickness or holiday. They even sell the session to other parents, doubling their profit. This expense can put some parents off returning to work and make family holidays less affordable.

attributes.action: Ban the importation and distribution of all dyed fish.
attributes.background: Dyeing fish is completely unatural and inhumane. Fish that have been injected with these dyes suffer a dramatically shortened life span and are much more susceptible to infection and disease. It is said that in most cases only 50% of fish actually survive the procedure.
attributes.additional_details: Reference - http://www.pets4homes.co.uk/pet-advice/the-phenomenon-of-dyed-fish-and-how-to-avoid-it.html

attributes.action: Look into the spiralling costs of funerals.
attributes.background:
A certainty that we will all be faced with... only until it happens to a loved one how many of you have thought about the costs associated with a funeral? A basic funeral at today's price is roughly £3000 projected to rise up to £6000 by 2023*

*figures taken from one funeral director.
attributes.additional_details:
The above cost is bad enough but doesn't stop there as it doesn't include the following to name a few: Embalming, burial plot, memorial or headstone, flowers, catering/wake.

I recently lost my sister at the age of 32, taken early & wouldn't have put anything in place to cover the costs.  As a result at what is a very difficult time for all involved we had to cover the costs.

A stress that isn't needed at a time when grieving & an issue that people then want to put behind them.

attributes.action: Make stolen motorcycle information freely available to the public.
attributes.background: Information pertaining to stolen powered two wheelers should be freely available. Registration numbers, VIN numbers and engine numbers of all vehicles reported stolen should be available on a free to use Government website with the aim of reducing theft by making stolen PTW's harder to sell.
attributes.additional_details: In the period Jan-15 to Mar-15, 6574 PTW's were reported as stolen (source www.met.police.uk/foi/pdfs/disclosure_2016/may_2016/2016030001373.pdf)  Many of these, especially in the London area have been used in robberies of individuals and shops.  As information on stolen PTW's is already available on pay to use sources, I would like to request that information held by Govt. agencies regarding theft status, colour changes and insurance history (e.g. write offs) be made freely available.

attributes.action: Fine neglectful parents who send there children to school when child is unwell.
attributes.background: Change the law and fine parents that send there child to school when the child is unwell or ill. Not meeting the child's needs is classed as neglect. Children will not learn when they feel poorly and they spread germs to other healthy children.
attributes.additional_details:
Neglect
In this type of child maltreatment there is a failure to provide for a child's basic physical or emotional needs, which is likely to damage the child's health or development.
Not helping a child to have the medical care or treatment that they need. This includes having their normal routine immunisations and attending hospital appointments. It also includes not giving them medication which has been prescribed.

Copy from in part.  http://patient.info/health/safeguarding-children

attributes.action: Create fair & honest revenue stream for NHS & social care with hypothecated tax
attributes.background: It's time UK govt & people had a grown-up relationship with NHS and social care funding. Replace NI contributions with a stand alone tax to fund NHS & social care. The people would then see the true costs and politicians could say how much or how little they were willing to raise in their manifesto
attributes.additional_details: Obviously not all tax revenue comes from people's income. There would still be a proportion coming from Corporation, Value Added and other tax raising streams. However these proportions could be protected so the percentage of burden on the population's income always remains the same.

attributes.action: Keep dove house in bushy fields hospital open and support mental health
attributes.background: Bushy fields hospitals dove house is used as a drop in centre for people suffering with mental health conditions

attributes.action: Increase income tax & CGT by 1% then raise NHS spending by 10%
attributes.background: It has become overwhelmingly apparent to the electorate that the NHS is struggling to function with many people left bedridden in corridors, operations cancelled and lifesaving treatments being denied to those most in need.
attributes.additional_details:
With 2015 total tax receipts being £533bn of which 56% is raised through Income Tax, NI & CBT. We believe a 1% raise on the 3 tiers of income tax as well as CGT will raise sufficient funding to increase spending on our NHS by no less than 10%. 

Government Tax Receipts:
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/539194/Jun16_Receipts_NS_Bulletin_Final.pdf 

NHS Deficit:
https://www.kingsfund.org.uk/publications/deficits-nhs-2016

attributes.action: For Brexit Success: Abolish Business Rates and Make Up The Difference in VAT.
attributes.background: UK Businesses are grossly overcharged in business rates without bearing on the revenue they generate. Almost 4% of UK GDP is from these rates, verses 0.65% in the rest of Europe. UK businesses have to charge more to compensate, making them less competitive. Move to VAT would level the playing field.
attributes.additional_details:
[1]http://moneyweek.com/its-time-to-abolish-business-rates/
[2]https://www.retail-week.com/topics/policy-and-legal/uk-has-the-highest-business-rates-bill-across-eu-says-report/5049347.article
[3]http://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/11912104/George-Osborne-unveils-radical-business-rates-overhaul.html
[4]http://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/retailandconsumer/11815278/Business-tsar-backs-plea-for-business-rates-cut.html
For a small change in VAT the burden is removed from British Business.

attributes.action: Enforce the Consumer Rights Act to protect music, arts and sport fans from touts
attributes.background: Fans are being ripped-off by ticket resales. The Consumer Rights Act has not changed this. We demand that Parliament enact last year’s ticket resale amendment, which provides tougher sanctions for resale websites, and also require ticket resellers to reveal their identities.
